intro: Heptapleurum heterophyllum var. heterophyllum, commonly known as the heterophyllous heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphological variation, where different parts of the plant exhibit distinct leaf shapes. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its leaves are usually alternate, with some being ovate and others cordate, showcasing its heterophyllous nature. This variation is thought to be an adaptation to different light conditions within its natural habitat.
